quote: GoodFellas, which somehow mixes its horrors with a deep vein of mordant humor, flows with the exuberance of a filmmaker who has every detail nailed and a few new lovely moves he wants to show us.
title: Goodfellas

quote: Spanning thirty years and running two and a half hours, the film bristles with the violent passion, howitzer wit and virtuoso style that made Scorsese's reputation with the gangster drama Mean Streets in 1973.
title: Goodfellas

quote: In GoodFellas, Scorsese, that connoisseur of mean streets and brutish, reflexive rage, has fashioned a stunning film that belongs on the same lonely, top shelf as Coppola's Mafia saga.
title: Goodfellas

quote: Robert De Niro gives what has come to be a typical Robert De Niro performance -- understated, sly, ingratiating. Joe Pesci, as the hot-tempered Tommy, steals several scenes from his fellow performers.
title: Goodfellas

quote: The most profoundly Catholic of contemporary filmmakers, Scorsese has here imagined a world without the slightest notion of sin-everything is permitted, and he is both fascinated and appalled by the total freedom of his characters.
title: Goodfellas

quote: In GoodFellas, director Martin Scorsese does something simple and audacious: He takes the guilt out of organized crime.
title: Goodfellas

quote: You walk away, tantalized by a view into the darkest part of yourself, glad that that part is still behind bars.
title: Goodfellas

quote: Colorful but dramatically unsatisfying.
title: Goodfellas

quote: The filmmakers have come up with some images that are sheerest nightmare. The film earns its shudders honestly: Scott is too talented to need gratuitousness as a aid.
title: Alien

quote: After 40 years, this sci-fi horror masterpiece still feels lethally contemporary.
title: Alien

quote: Everything shrieks fit to burst, ignoring the poster tagline ("In space no one can hear you scream").
title: Alien

quote: This is a screamingly spooky sci-fi tale with more than a few echoes of "The Thing" but echoes which enhance rather than detract.
title: Alien

quote: A sci-fi thriller of palpable, nerve-tingling tension, with Sigourney Weaver -- playing warrant officer Ellen Ripley -- in stunning form.
title: Alien

quote: Seen again a quarter-century later, we marvel at how the filmmaker generates so much tension and sweat with a bare minimum of moving parts.
title: Alien

quote: If you want cinematic kicks, Ridley Scott's massively successful Alien will give you them in profusion.
title: Alien

quote: The limited strengths of its staple sci-fi horrors always derived from either the offhand organic/ Freudian resonances of its design or the purely (brilliantly) manipulative editing and pacing of its above-average shock quota.
title: Alien

quote: The most startling thing watching Alien again is its pacing. For the first 45 minutes, little happens. It's all slow, exquisite build-up, which makes the second half seem all the more horrific.
title: Alien

quote: It is depressing to watch an expensive, crafty movie that never soars beyond its cold desire to score the big bucks.
title: Alien

quote: The limited strengths of its staple sci-fi horrors always derived from either the offhand organic/ Freudian resonances of its design or the purely (brilliantly) manipulative editing and pacing of its above-average shock quota.
title: Alien

quote: An old-fashioned scary movie set in a highly realistic sci-fi future, made all the more believable by expert technical craftmanship.
title: Alien

quote: An empty-headed horror movie with nothing to recommend it beyond the disco-inspired art direction and some handsome, if gimmicky, cinematography.
title: Alien

quote: A genuine fright classic.
title: Alien

quote: These things no longer surprise or tantalize us as they once did. In a very short time, science-fiction films have developed their own jargon that's now become a part of the grammar.
title: Alien

quote: Alien will upset your mind and upset your stomach.
title: Alien

quote: Alien looks amazing, almost like a new film.
title: Alien

quote: Ridley Scott's new cut won't change the way people think about the movie, but it reinforces the film's strengths without alienating the series' biggest fans.
title: Alien

quote: Ridley Scott's 1979 movie is a great original.
title: Alien

quote: It's a most satisfying return to one of the few sci-fi films that deserves to be called a masterpiece.
title: Alien

quote: Ran takes film spectacle to new heights. Kurosawa continues not only to extend his own powers but to exploit new technical advances.
title: Ran

quote: There is not a wasted second. [Here] is proof of what we seldom doubted: Kurosawa is a director who becomes godlike rather than gaga in old age.
title: Ran

quote: Kurosawa may not be Shakespeare, but with images like these, he gets at something about the horror -- and hopelessness -- of being a man that is peculiarly his own.
title: Ran

quote: Prepare your eyes to be gouged (this is a King Lear adaptation, after all).
title: Ran

quote: If anything, Ran is even darker and more pessimistic than the original.
title: Ran

quote: Its true power is found in the small moments.
title: Ran

quote: This is one of the year's major cinematic events. It's well worth leaving the house for, should that opportunity arise.
title: Ran

quote: Ran remains gripping because it depicts not only the long-ago past, but also our hellish present.
title: Ran

quote: Ran is one of the cinema's greatest works, a film of true tragic vision.
title: Ran

quote: One of the supreme cinematic achievements of the last quarter-century.
title: Ran

quote: A film for the ages.
title: Ran

quote: Ultimately it is this mixture of the grand gesture and the fine touch, the big world and the small people who occupy it, that lingers with us long after Ran is over.
title: Ran

quote: By the time Kurosawa's camera comes to rest on the film's final, poignant image, a painting of the Buddha that one character had promised another would protect him from harm, the movie seemingly has accomplished the impossible: one-upping Shakespeare.
title: Ran

quote: There's probably more carnage in Ran than there is in Rambo and The Terminator combined, but the new film substitutes intelligence and emotion for mindlessness and emotionalism. You leave the theater awestruck, not dumbstruck.
title: Ran

quote: What could be more exciting than the prospect of one of the giants of world cinema, his career resuscitated, adapting Shakespeare's most modern play?
title: Ran

quote: What's remarkable about Ran is that the drama enhances the spectacle the same way the spectacle bolsters the drama. Few other directors had Kurosawa's ability to convey the intimate as well as the epic, to handle stillness as well as violence.
title: Ran

quote: It is a film that already belongs to the ages.
title: Ran

quote: For aficionados of the war movie, the western, and the period action epic, Ran is necessary viewing.
title: Ran

quote: At age 75, the director has made his most costly epic to date, and it's a dazzlingly successful addition to his distinguished career.
title: Ran

quote: Akira Kurosawa's 1985 film is slightly marred by some too obvious straining toward masterpiece status, yet it's a stunning achievement in epic cinema.
title: Ran

quote: It is one of [Hitchcock's] most brilliantly directed shockers and also his most disagreeable.
title: Psycho

quote: A brilliant technical exercise, an intimate character study, and the ultimate variant on the premise "boy meets girl."
title: Psycho

quote: Paramount won't let anyone enter theatres where Psycho is playing after the picture starts. No one will want to leave before it is over.
title: Psycho

quote: The obvious thing to say is that Hitch has done it again; that the suspense of his picture builds up slowly but surely to an almost unbearable pitch of excitement.
title: Psycho

quote: Even now, it's distinctly unnerving.
title: Psycho

quote: After half a century of terror, Psycho is still ensuring that no one feels safe in the shower.
title: Psycho

quote: Watching Psycho today we are all, like Marion in the shower, vainly trying to recover lost innocence too late.
title: Psycho

quote: Hitchcock is the most-daring avant-garde film-maker in America today.
title: Psycho

quote: The best that can be said is there are bats in the belfry and a well-preserved corpse in the basement. What else can one do but scream?
title: Psycho

quote: Always worth another look, especially on the big screen.
title: Psycho

quote: Look into Janet Leigh's eye after the shower scene and be amazed how fresh this black-and-white ghoulish chic seems in the saccharine surroundings of modern cinema.
title: Psycho

quote: It blazed a bloody trail for the much-loved slasher cycle, but it also assured us that a B-movie could be A-grade in quality and innovation.
title: Psycho

quote: Two murders and a third attempt are among the most vicious I have ever seen in films, with Hitchcock employing his considerable skill in direction and cutting and in the use of sound and music to shock us past horror-entertainment into resentment.
title: Psycho

quote: Director Hitchcock bears down too heavily in this one, and the delicate illusion of reality necessary for a creak-and-shriek movie becomes, instead, a spectacle of stomach-churning horror.
title: Psycho

quote: An unusual, good entertainment, indelibly Hitchcock, and on the right kind of boxoffice beam.
title: Psycho

quote: Alfred Hitchcock's 1960 masterpiece blends a brutal manipulation of audience identification and an incredibly dense, allusive visual style to create the most morally unsettling film ever made.
title: Psycho

quote: Gripping and irrevocably gruesome fare played to perfection by a top notch cast.
title: Psycho

quote: [Hitchcock] has very shrewdly interwoven crime, sex and suspense, blended the real and the unreal in fascinating proportions and punctuated his film with several quick, grisly and unnerving surprises.
title: Psycho

quote: All those who still get a chill every time they step into a hotel shower, say aye. That, you see, is the power of Psycho.
title: Psycho

quote: With the exception of Halloween, no latter-day horror/thriller has been capable of generating as many goosebumps.
title: Psycho

quote: There is no more material sustaining The Blues Brothers"than one would find in a silent comedy short running 10 or 20 minutes.
title: The Blues Brothers

quote: The film retains a huge nostalgic kick, thanks in large part to Aykroyd and Belushi's easy rapport, a smattering of daft, shaggy humour and some truly iconic musical sequences.
title: The Blues Brothers

quote: I have never been quite sure why this $30 million comedy made by John Landis in 1980 became such a cult.
title: The Blues Brothers

quote: Formless, chaotic and lazy, and quite brilliant because of it.
title: The Blues Brothers

quote: The mere spectacle of Elwood and Jake in their shades isn't quite as giggle-inducing as it presumably was back in 1980, but the stunts are still awe-inspiring, and there's plenty of laughs. They really were thinking big.
title: The Blues Brothers

quote: There's no indication that Landis knows what the words "pace" or "mood" mean. He operates on one track.
title: The Blues Brothers

quote: A demolition symphony that works with the cold efficiency of a Moog synthesizer gone sadistic.
title: The Blues Brothers

quote: Given all the chaos, director and, with Aykroyd, cowriter, John Landis manages to keep things reasonably controlled and in a straight line.
title: The Blues Brothers

quote: The humor is predicated on underplaying in overscaled situations, which is sporadically funny in a Keaton-esque way but soon sputters out through sheer, uninspired repetition.
title: The Blues Brothers

quote: There's even room, in the midst of the carnage and mayhem, for a surprising amount of grace, humor, and whimsy.
title: The Blues Brothers

quote: This essentially modest movie is reported to have cost about $30 million, and what did all that money buy? Scores of car crashes. Too many extras. Overstaged dance numbers. And a hollowness that certainly didn't come cheap.
title: The Blues Brothers

quote: In sheer physical terms, however, Godfather Part II displays even more spectacular panache than its predecessor.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: Few movie sequels are as good as the films they follow and even fewer have about them the air of necessity. Francis Ford Coppola's The Godfather Part II is among the rare exceptions.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: It goes much deeper than The Godfather in analyzing the twisted mentalities of these men who pervert the capitalist system for their own gain. The film is richer in texture and gives more evidence of social awareness.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: An admirable, responsible production, less emotionally disturbing than its predecessor, but a grand historical epic studying the nature of power in the United States' heritage.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: One of the greatest sequels ever.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: It is even better than the first film, and has the greatest single final scene in Hollywood history, a real coup de cinma.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: Either taken alone or together with the original, The Godfather Part II is an astounding work.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: One of the most ambitious and brilliantly executed American films, a landmark work from one of Hollywood's top cinema eras.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: This is quite simply one of the saddest movies ever made, a tale of loss, grief and absolute loneliness, an unflinching stare into the darkest moral abyss.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: Not once does Pacino overtly ask for the audience's sympathy, but through a disciplined, suggestive performance he dominates the film.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: The Paramount release has everything going for it.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: Francis Ford Coppola pulls it off in grand style.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: The performances, Gordon Willis' memorably gloomy camerawork, the stately pace and the sheer scale of the story's sweep render everything engrossing and so, well, plausible that our ideas of organised crime in America will forever be marked by this movie.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: The stunning text of The Godfather is replaced in Part II with prologues, epilogues, footnotes, and good intentions.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: It's a second movie made largely out of the bits and pieces of Mr. Puzo's novel that didn't fit into the first. It's a Frankenstein's monster stitched together from leftover parts. It talks. It moves in fits and starts but it has no mind of its own.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: The only sequel to win an Oscar for best picture.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: Few sequels have expanded upon the original with the faithfulness and detail of this one.
title: The Godfather: Part II

quote: Full Metal Jacket seems further proof that Kubrick is still trapped in self-pleasing cinematic exercise.
title: Full Metal Jacket

quote: If his considerable achievement in this long- awaited film falls short of his Olympian standards, there is a reason that ought to give Kubrick some satisfaction. The world has caught up with Kubrick and what he has to say.
title: Full Metal Jacket

quote: It may seem too spare, too clinical, its moments of war even too familiar for some. But, aiming for minds as well as hearts, Kubrick hits his target squarely.
title: Full Metal Jacket

quote: What gives this story its power is not really its originality, but the relentlessness of Kubrick's black-comic vision and the tightness of his focus.
title: Full Metal Jacket

quote: There is a real fear at the heart of this monstrously armored, desperately defensive film.
title: Full Metal Jacket

quote: It's a great piece of filmmaking, diminished only by a second act that fails to live up to the first act of the Marines in training.
title: Full Metal Jacket

quote: Full Metal Jacket is not a realistic film -- it is horror-comic superrealism, from a God's-eye view -- but it should fully engage the ordinary movie grunt.
title: Full Metal Jacket

quote: This is the most tightly crafted Kubrick film since Dr. Strangelove, as well as the most horrific; the first section alone accomplishes most of what The Shining failed to do.
title: Full Metal Jacket

quote: An intense, schematic, superbly made Vietnam War drama.
title: Full Metal Jacket

quote: Kubrick's direction is as steely cold and manipulative as the rgime it depicts, and we never really get to know, let alone care about, the hapless recruits on view.
title: Full Metal Jacket

quote: Although the elements of the story are simple and precise, Kubrick infuses a dreamlike, fatalistic quality.
title: Full Metal Jacket

quote: Kubrick's harrowing, beautiful and characteristically eccentric new film about Vietnam, is going to puzzle, anger and (I hope) fascinate audiences as much as any film he has made to date.
title: Full Metal Jacket

quote: No one who sees Full Metal Jacket will easily put the film's last glimpse of D'Onofrio, or a great many other things about Kubrick's latest and most sobering vision, out of mind.
title: Full Metal Jacket

quote: Full Metal Jacket, ice and wildfire, order and chaos, is intellectual war, hard thought.
title: Full Metal Jacket

quote: [A] strangely shapeless film from the man whose work usually imposes a ferociously consistent vision on his material.
title: Full Metal Jacket

quote: There is a great deal of value in Branagh`s version, not least in his own lead performance as a soft, indefinite Henry who defines himself over the course of the play.
title: Henry V

quote: If Olivier gave us the glint of sunlight on armor and the wind roaring through the pennants and flags, Branagh gives us the rot, the mold, the wounds and the crusted blood underneath.
title: Henry V

quote: A stirring, gritty and enjoyable pic which offers a plethora of fine performances from some of the U.K.'s brightest talents.
title: Henry V

quote: The cast -- including Derek Jacobi as the modern-dress chorus, Paul Scofield, Judi Dench, Ian Holm, Emma Thompson, and Robbie Coltrane in an effective cameo as Falstaff -- is uniformly fine without any grandstanding.
title: Henry V

quote: Branagh succeeds in his blunt, robust portrayal of the Soldier-King, hauling the film along in the wake of his own gung-ho performance.
title: Henry V

quote: Mr. Branagh's Henry has psychological heft and intellectual weight.
title: Henry V

quote: What works best in the film is the over-all vision.
title: Henry V

quote: More questioning, more agonized, finally more humble.
title: Henry V

quote: Everything about this remarkable production is exhilaratingly unexpected.
title: Henry V

quote: In this alert, rousing interpretation of Henry V, Branagh beats down the doors of high art and drags the sleeping bard into the light of modern day.
title: Henry V

quote: Tom HuIce's brattish Mozart builds in strength and sensitivity as the film proceeds; F. Murray Abraham's Salieri impresses immediately.
title: Amadeus

quote: Amadeus isn't meant to be a biography of the composer's life, but a bawdy, black fantasy, a fiction based on a few curious facts. Peter Shaffer adapted the screenplay from his own stage play: What was intimate is now opulent.
title: Amadeus

quote: A substantial achievement -- and graced by an uncommonly distinguished score.
title: Amadeus

quote: What starts as an absorbing study of historical characters and situations ends as just another elaborate and over-long Hollywood style costume-piece.
title: Amadeus

quote: The skill of Amadeus is in making you sympathize with Salieri, as slimy and despicable as he is, because of his flaws. He appeals to your sense of democracy, even though you know that talent -- certainly genius -- isn't parceled out democratically.
title: Amadeus

quote: Sheer craftsmanship is the film's key strength.
title: Amadeus

quote: The performance of Abraham, who won the Best Actor Oscar for it, is monumental, and so is Forman's direction.
title: Amadeus

quote: Forman's tormented, iconoclastic subjects are often pitted against iconic or impersonal antagonists, but Amadeus' conflict remains rivetingly intimate, in spite of its sumptuous, larger-than-life settings.
title: Amadeus

quote: The subject of artistic creation is typically handled badly in the movies.... [Amadeus] treats the subject of creativity in a fresh way.
title: Amadeus

quote: A grand movie entertainment.
title: Amadeus

quote: On a production level and as an evocation of a time and place, Amadeus is loaded with pleasures.
title: Amadeus

quote: [A] grandiose masterpiece.
title: Amadeus

quote: Peter Shaffer's shrewdly orchestrated cultural evening gets a steady, dignified, moderately dull treatment from Milos Forman.
title: Amadeus

quote: The entire cast speaks in horribly intrusive American accents, but Forman makes some perceptive connections between Mozart's life and work.
title: Amadeus

quote: It is arguably the best motion picture ever made about the process of creation and the creator.
title: Amadeus

quote: As Mozart, Tom Hulce, though extremely American in looks and voice, gets better and better as the drama progresses.
title: Amadeus

quote: This 'special edition' of Amadeus proves that Abraham's Oscar triumph was no fluke.
title: Amadeus

quote: Reminds us that movies can be lyrical as well as vulgar, ambitious as well as playful, brilliant as well as down and dirty -- just like Amadeus himself.
title: Amadeus

quote: Remains a beautiful, deftly directed and superbly acted version of a witty and poignant drama.
title: Amadeus

quote: In a film of grand gestures, some of the finest moments are very subtle.
title: Amadeus

quote: The Quiet Man is John Ford's best picture since The Informer, but much, much funnier.
title: The Quiet Man

quote: As much an anthropological adventure as a romantic rhapsody.
title: The Quiet Man

quote: This is a robust romantic drama of a native-born's return to Ireland. Director John Ford took cast and cameras to Ireland to tell the story [by Maurice Walsh] against actual backgrounds.
title: The Quiet Man

quote: John Ford's 1952 Oscar winner is a tribute to an Ireland that exists only in the imaginations of songwriters and poets like Ford.
title: The Quiet Man

quote: The illusion/reality theme underlying immigrant boxer Wayne's return from America to County Galway is soon swamped within a vibrant community of stage-Irish 'types'.
title: The Quiet Man

quote: Let's face it. Mr. Ford is in love with Ireland, as is his cast, and they give us a fine, gay time while they're about it.
title: The Quiet Man

quote: Wayne and O'Hara create a fine rapport, with good performances that build to a truly satisfying climax.
title: The Quiet Man

quote: Although not a true classic, The Quiet Man is worth more than a cursory glance, especially for those who like Wayne or would like to experience more of his work.
title: The Quiet Man

quote: The movie's four hours long, but no one had the time to write a single real character.
title: Once Upon a Time in America

quote: This would-be epic schlep, dragging almost 50 years of chronology over a sluggish 140 minutes, is far too slight of text and ponderous of presentation to sustain more than nodding-off dramatic interest.
title: Once Upon a Time in America

quote: Adding 22 minutes only enhances Leone's brilliant saga of guilt and betrayal
title: Once Upon a Time in America

quote: Sergio Leone's languid, lovely and lengthy ode to Lower East Side mobsters (more specifically, mobster films) ...
title: Once Upon a Time in America

quote: Leone is less interested in arousing an audience's easier emotions than in presenting, at a dispassionate distance, the horror of two men warily walking toward each other on a tightrope suspended above the snake pit of their , deepest compulsions.
title: Once Upon a Time in America

quote: Every gesture is immediate, and every gesture seems eternal.
title: Once Upon a Time in America

quote: A disappointment of considerable proportions.
title: Once Upon a Time in America

quote: While Leone's vision still has a magnificent sweep, the film finally subsides to an emotional core that is sombre, even elegiac, and which centres on a man who is bent and broken by time, and finally left with nothing but an impotent sadness.
title: Once Upon a Time in America

quote: There are times when we don't understand exactly what is happening, but never a time when we don't feel confidence in the film's narrative.
title: Once Upon a Time in America

quote: As one would expect from Leone, the film is a brilliant stylistic accomplishment.
title: Once Upon a Time in America

quote: A lazily haullucinatory epic that means to encapsulate approximately 50 years of American social history into a single film.
title: Once Upon a Time in America

quote: The film slips easily back and forth in time, dancing between the decades, often making the connection from one era to another solely by means of brilliant cuts that work like magic.
title: Once Upon a Time in America

quote: Seeing what Leone always intended is like getting your dirty glasses washed.
title: Once Upon a Time in America

quote: Scorsese goes overboard in an attempt at low-keyed naturalism, however, and there is little dramatic structure to the biographical overview... But there's no denying the power and artistry of De Niro's performance.
title: Raging Bull

quote: This is a masterpiece. It proves that a film can have violent undertones and overtones, but still illuminate and comment upon violence in a moving, poetic and profound way.
title: Raging Bull

quote: Martin Scorsese's obsession with a dubious mystique of masculinity turns "Raging Bull" into a ponderous work of metaphysical cinematic bull.
title: Raging Bull

quote: "Raging Bull" ultimately has a numbing effect on the brain as if one's head had been pummeled by La Motta's so-called "girlish" fists.
title: Raging Bull

quote: When has a performer as fully and uniquely sacrificed himself to the moving-picture cause as De Niro?
title: Raging Bull

quote: De Niro is always absorbing and credible, even when his character isn't.
title: Raging Bull

quote: A classic that has everything to do with the capacity of even highly successful men to cope with life in general, and women in particular.
title: Raging Bull

quote: De Niro and Joe Pesci are impeccable and Cathy Moriarty is iconically sexy.
title: Raging Bull

quote: This savagely authentic film about flawed masculinity is worth seeking out for another viewing if the summer's toothless blockbuster fodder is getting you down.
title: Raging Bull

quote: Martin Scorsese makes pictures about the kinds of people you wouldn't want to know.
title: Raging Bull

quote: I can't pan it, but this 1980 fantasy biography of fighter Jake LaMotta seems unquestionably Martin Scorsese's weakest work, at least to that point in his career.
title: Raging Bull

quote: This film does more than make you think about masculinity, it makes you see it -- in a way that's relevant to all men, not just Bronx boxers.
title: Raging Bull

quote: The film that many consider the finest of its decade.
title: Raging Bull

quote: An underdog in its day and a classic today.
title: Raging Bull

quote: Though Raging Bull has only three principal characters, it is a big film, its territory being the landscape of the soul.
title: Raging Bull

quote: Every swirling camera movement, every distinctive angle, has a real reason for existing in this story of world middleweight boxing champ Jake La Motta.
title: Raging Bull

quote: The most obvious basis for the film's claim to greatness lies in Scorsese's devastating critique of the very codes of masculinity that shaped him as a filmmaker, and in Robert De Niro's performance, through which that critique is made flesh.
title: Raging Bull

quote: There's no room for romanticism in the ring with inky black blood staining the canvas. During fight sequences, the director also uses a number of point-of-view shots designed to show the world, however briefly, from La Motta's perspective.
title: Raging Bull

quote: It's the best film I've seen about the low self-esteem, sexual inadequacy and fear that lead some men to abuse women.
title: Raging Bull

quote: Annie Hall is as good as it is because its comedy is always on the brink of the minor tragedies of real life and love.
title: Annie Hall

quote: Romantic, honest, and touching - all the kinds of things one wants from a smart rom-com that refuses to be guided by the genre's tropes.
title: Annie Hall

quote: A soft, fuzzy, mildly diverting letdown.
title: Annie Hall

quote: Woody Allen fans will buy it 100%. Never before has the diminutive comedian been so urbane, so open - so funny. And with lovely Diane Keaton as consort, it becomes well-nigh irresistible (especially if you find Keaton as well-nigh irresistible as I do).
title: Annie Hall

quote: This is Woody Allen's signature film, arguably his best and certainly his most popular.
title: Annie Hall

quote: Allen (as a result of his exposure to Bergman, perhaps) has greatly matured as a filmmaking talent. Annie Hall is, by far, his most sophisticated, most emotionally complex film.
title: Annie Hall

quote: While its consonance comes largely from Gordon Willis's photography and Allen's spacious sense of New York, pathos comes at best from Keaton's evaporative performance and a slightly sentimental conception.
title: Annie Hall

quote: Allen joins the Catskills tummler's anything-for-a-laugh antics with a Eurocentric art-house self-awareness and a psychoanalytic obsession in baring his sexual desires and frustrations, romantic disasters, and neurotic inhibitions.
title: Annie Hall

quote: This is the link between Allen's "earlier, funnier" stuff and more probing works like Interiors and Manhattan. Would that we all could build such masterful bridges.
title: Annie Hall

quote: In Annie Hall, Allen again writes, directs and stars with Diane Keaton in a remarkable recreation of a spent love affair, which is both sad and hysterically funny.
title: Annie Hall

quote: Personal as the story he is telling may be, what separates this film from Allen's own past work and most other recent comedy is its general believability.
title: Annie Hall

quote: A touching and hilarious love story that is Allen's most three-dimensional film to date.
title: Annie Hall

quote: Lovely performances, and more superb gags in one minute than most movies manage in 90.
title: Annie Hall

quote: Visually and structurally it's a mess, but many of the situations are genuinely clever, and there are plenty of memorable gags.
title: Annie Hall

quote: If you can forgive the fact that it's a ragbag of half-digested intellectual ideas dressed up with trendy intellectual references, you should have a good laugh.
title: Annie Hall

quote: There will be discussion about what points in the film coincide with the lives of its two stars, but this, I think, is to detract from and trivialize the achievement of the film, which, at last, puts Woody in the league with the best directors we have.
title: Annie Hall

quote: Watching it again, 25 years after its April 1977 premiere, I am astonished by how scene after scene has an instant familiarity.
title: Annie Hall

quote: It's a slight story but what makes this film significant in Allen's long career is that it's really the first time he wrote adult characters.
title: Annie Hall

quote: Philip Kaufman's 1983 film is an efficient and absorbing recapitulation of the main events of Tom Wolfe's book that still never succeeds in capturing the inner drives and ethics of the test pilots and astronauts - the "right stuff" never materializes.
title: The Right Stuff

quote: Rarely has a film made a historic accomplishment seem so vivid and personal... It makes you wonder, quite suddenly, why there aren't more movies like this.
title: The Right Stuff

quote: The Right Stuff is a spectacular celebration of those heroes of the skies -- those fly jocks who fought the demons of space to launch a new era in American air technology.
title: The Right Stuff

title: Chinatown

quote: It takes a Herculean effort to transform this type into a character and to replace the formula with a story, and Chinatown's success in both of these regards is one of the reasons it is universally viewed as a classic.

quote: Amounts to an amazing achievement of cinematic storytelling.
title: Chinatown

quote: [Nicholson's] performance is key in keeping Chinatown from becoming just a genre crime picture--that, and a Robert Towne screenplay that evokes an older Los Angeles.
title: Chinatown

quote: The Day the Earth Stood Still may at first look like goofy, outdated science fiction, but its timeless warnings about violence, nuclear confrontation and the difficulties of policing the planet have made it an enduring cultural classic.
title: The Day the Earth Stood Still

quote: Like most of Robert Wise's work, this slickly constructed 1951 science fiction film settles squarely in the middle of its genre, better than some and worse than others.
title: The Day the Earth Stood Still

quote: Cast, although secondary to the story, works well.
title: The Day the Earth Stood Still

quote: Edmund H North's intelligent script and Wise's smooth direction are serious without being solemn, while Bernard Herrmann's effectively alien-sounding score reinforces the atmosphere of strangeness and potential menace.
title: The Day the Earth Stood Still

quote: Today, wistful viewers might ask: Where are Klaatu and Gort when we need them most?
title: The Day the Earth Stood Still

quote: It is comforting, of course, to have it made plain that our planetary neighbors are much wiser and more peaceful than are we, but this makes for a tepid entertainment in what is anamolously labeled the science-fiction field.
title: The Day the Earth Stood Still

quote: John Huston has rarely been in better form than in this 1948 study of gold fever and worse obsessions among an unlikely trio of prospectors...
title: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre

quote: There's a quite enjoyable yarn buried under the hollow laughter.
title: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre

quote: The movie has never really been about gold but about character, and Bogart fearlessly makes Fred C. Dobbs into a pathetic, frightened, selfish man -- so sick we would be tempted to pity him, if he were not so undeserving of pity.
title: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre

quote: Greed, a despicable passion out of which other base ferments may spawn, is seldom treated in the movies with the frank and ironic contempt that is vividly manifested toward it in Treasure of Sierra Madre.
title: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre

quote: The characters here are probed and thoroughly penetrated, not through psychoanalysis but through a crucible of human conflict, action, gesture and expressive facial tones.
title: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre

quote: It turns out that the sharp-tongued humour of Groucho Marx is ageless, the slapstick timely and the subject matter still pertinent: loony dictatorship, religion, pointless warfare.
title: Duck Soup

quote: The sheer silliness is inspired ...
title: Duck Soup

quote: Questioning the canonical standing of a titan such as Duck Soup seems like an exercise in questioning the tastes of those who like it rather than the upbraiding the comedy mechanics of the film itself.
title: Duck Soup

quote: Genius just about covers it.
title: Duck Soup

quote: Duck Soup should make practically everybody laugh.
title: Duck Soup

quote: The Marx Brothers' best movie...
title: Duck Soup

quote: It also includes what is perhaps the Brothers' funniest scene ever: an immaculately timed and performed sequence with a broken mirror in which Groucho, Chico and Harpo look absolutely identical. A masterpiece.
title: Duck Soup

quote: Unpredictable, hilarious, and completely deranged. Duck Soup is without doubt the distillation of everything that the Marx Brothers claimed as their own.
title: Duck Soup

quote: This production is, for the most part, extremely noisy without being nearly as mirthful as [the Marx brothers'] other films.
title: Duck Soup

quote: The Marx Brothers created a body of work in which individual films are like slices from the whole, but Duck Soup (1933) is probably the best.

quote: There's a potentially edgy aspect to Better Off Dead's comedy that's never fully realized.

quote: Mired in this is Cusack ("The Sure Thing"), an unusually adept verbal comedian not so adept (to his credit) at this kind of slapstick.
title: Better Off Dead...

quote: The film doesn't seem to have much of a focus. But it doesn't seem to want one, either.
title: Better Off Dead...

quote: The classic Stanley Kubrick film isn't just scary - it is also, in its own odd way, defined by a hopeful perspective on life and death.
title: The Shining

quote: It's an interesting movie, but not the ultimate work in its genre that some expected from one of the great directors.
title: The Shining

quote: Kubrick is master of visual images, and many of the scenes display his brilliance. But much of the suspense ends in anti-climax, and Jack Nicholson and Shelley Duvall seem over-extended in trying to maintain the terror.
title: The Shining

quote: When you sit down to The Shining, you sit down with normal expectations of being diverted, perhaps even being gripped, but not being undermined. But the film undermines you in powerful, inchoate ways.
title: The Shining

quote: Shock effect and graphic imagery don't compensate for the sense of pointlessness and even distaste that is left at the end of the movie.
title: The Shining

quote: If The Shining isn't trivial, it certainly encourages one to think that it is. But, perhaps, even that's a change for the better. Generally, it's the other way around.
title: The Shining

quote: A masterpiece.
title: The Shining

quote: Deeply scary and strange.
title: The Shining

quote: Essential viewing. Prepare to be disturbed.
title: The Shining

quote: Kubrick has made a movie that will have to be reckoned with on the highest level.
title: The Shining

quote: As a ghost story and adaptation of the Stephen King novel, it's largely a failure. On the other hand, as an example of directorial bravura and as a study of madness and the unreliable narrator, it's a brilliant success.
title: The Shining

quote: Kubrick is after a cool, sunlit vision of hell, born in the bosom of the nuclear family, but his imagery -- with its compulsive symmetry and brightness -- is too banal to sustain interest, while the incredibly slack narrative line forestalls suspense.
title: The Shining

quote: The movie is not about ghosts but about madness and the energies it sets loose in an isolated situation primed to magnify them.
title: The Shining

quote: With everything to work with, director Stanley Kubrick has teamed with jumpy Jack Nicholson to destroy all that was so terrifying about Stephen King's bestseller.
title: The Shining

quote: I fear all work and no play has made Stanley a dull boy.
title: The Shining

quote: I can't recall a more elaborately ineffective scare movie.
title: The Shining

quote: Boy will it chill your blood.
title: The Shining

quote: Kubrick isn't out for screams, but he manages to make his movie thoroughly unnerving by keeping the horror so close to home.
title: The Shining

quote: Stand by Me is a small, quiet film that walks tall and resonates long after.
title: Stand by Me

quote: Its perspective is that of a knowing adult, which is to say that though the film is frequently affectionate and funny, it contains a drop too much condescension to be entirely successful.
title: Stand by Me

quote: It stands, sweet and strong, ribald, outrageous and funny, like its heroes themselves -- a bit gamy around the edges, perhaps, but pure and fine clear through. It's one of those treasures absolutely not to be missed.
title: Stand by Me

quote: Stand by Me is a film of honorable ambitions severely compromised by a creeping show-biz phoniness.
title: Stand by Me

quote: Reiner seems lost in his own cinematic wilderness -- button-down careful, almost afraid to move
title: Stand by Me

quote: Good luck choking back the tears, folks.
title: Stand by Me

quote: Scripters have written inspired dialog for this quartet of plucky boys at that hard-to-capture age when they're still young enough to get scared and yet old enough to want to sneak smokes and cuss.
title: Stand by Me

quote: The film is so well-observed and so energetically acted by its young cast that mawkishness is kept at bay.
title: Stand by Me

quote: Rob Reiner's direction hammers in every obvious element in an obvious script.
title: Stand by Me

quote: It's as effective in 2009 as it was upon its initial release, and the richness of its tapestry, densely woven from human emotions and character interaction, ensure it will never lose that relevance.
title: Stand by Me

quote: Be afraid. Be properly afraid. The greatest creation of Fritz Lang's career remains one of the most disturbing movies of his, or any, film-making era.
title: M

quote: Lang's movie is that rare thing, a nail-biting soul-searcher. While M steers clear of analyzing deviance, it is startling in its musings on which punishment fits an inhuman crime.
title: M

quote: Our identification with [Lorre] as a psychopath is so complete it's hard to believe that while appearing before Fritz Lang's cameras in the daytime, he was, at night, acting as a comedian in a farce.
title: M

quote: It is a cousin to the early Hitchcock of The Lodger, and I have always found something even something faintly Ealingesque about its cynicism and satire.
title: M

quote: You'll never look at a novelty balloon in the same way again.
title: M

quote: Few films are gripping and effective 82 years after their original release, but this one surely is.
title: M

quote: This is a movie that dares to sympathize with a sick person, that risks making the monster real and us (in an era when Germany's cinema was still shellacked in canted angles and fanciful shadows).
title: M

quote: Put simply, without M to show the way, there might have been no subsequent films in which a hidden killer unmasks the ills of the society around him
title: M

quote: The moral issues are complex and deftly handled: Lorre is at once entirely innocent and absolutely evil. Lang's detached, modified expressionist style gives the action a plastic beauty.
title: M

quote: An extraordinary, good, impressive and strong talker. Again fine work by Fritz Lang, and his wife and helper, Thea von Harbou.
title: M

quote: A subversive film, or more simply a movie brimming over with the ferment of Lang's imagination at its height? You choose.
title: M

quote: [An] important film which rightly deserves its success.
title: M

quote: It's an impeccable film -- a model of psychological suspense and a stunning display of Lang's power and skill.
title: M

quote: Lorre's performance as a desperate killer who insists he can't help himself remains his finest hour on film.
title: M

quote: The film doesn't ask for sympathy for the killer Franz Becker, but it asks for understanding: As he says in his own defense, he cannot escape or control the evil compulsions that overtake him.
title: M

quote: This astonishing movie represents an unsurpassed grand synthesis of storytelling.
title: M

quote: For all its missteps, when it comes to escapism, intrigue, and indulgence, you could do a whole lot worse than The Great Escape. Just watch it with an open eye.
title: The Great Escape

quote: This is a Boys' Own Tale, and, as boys, we wanted it, cleansed of horrors, for ourselves.
title: The Great Escape

quote: The Great Escape is simply great escapism.
title: The Great Escape

quote: Producer-director John Sturges has fashioned a motion picture that entertains, captivates, thrills and stirs.
title: The Great Escape

quote: Way too flabby at 168 minutes, but once this 1963 feature gets going it's good, solid stuff.
title: The Great Escape

quote: Worth seeing the last half hour, if nothing else, for one of the best stunt sequences in years: McQueen's motor-cycle bid for freedom.
title: The Great Escape

quote: It's a strictly mechanical adventure with make-believe men.
title: The Great Escape

quote: The wayward, maddening screenplay succeeds only in working up a gruesome melodramatic later -- hardly the catharsis promised by a bold treatment of the wounds of our most divisive war.
title: The Deer Hunter

title: The Deer Hunter

quote: While it's fair to argue that The Deer Hunter contains moments of brilliance, the film as a whole is undone by its length.
title: The Deer Hunter

quote: The movie won five Oscars and, if anything, improves with age.
title: The Deer Hunter

quote: It has no more moral intelligence than the Clint Eastwood action pictures, yet it's an astonishing piece of work, an uneasy mixture of violent pulp and grandiosity, with an enraptured view of common life -- poetry of the commonplace.
title: The Deer Hunter

quote: In trying to measure the devastating impact of Vietnam on the lives of three American soldiers, Cimino brings home the true horror of that senseless conflict in a way that the 6 O'Clock News never could.
title: The Deer Hunter

quote: The idea of sacrifice permeates everything, along with the cruelty and horror. This is Cimino's masterpiece.
title: The Deer Hunter

quote: Heart-on-sleeve stuff that works despite some of its more egregious impulses.
title: The Deer Hunter

quote: The Deer Hunter, Hollywood's first epic venture into the vexed territory of the Vietnam war, is a film of lacerating and astonishing brilliance.
title: The Deer Hunter

quote: Is it as good as its advance word and nine Academy Award nominations suggest? Yes.
title: The Deer Hunter

quote: This excruciatingly violent, three-hour Viet Nam saga demolishes the moral and ideological cliches of an era: it shoves the audience into hell and leaves it stranded without a map.
title: The Deer Hunter

quote: The film is ambitious and it succeeds on a number of levels and it proves that Cimino is an important director who deserves to be watched carefully.
title: The Deer Hunter

quote: A disgusting account of what the evil Vietnamese did to poor, innocent Americans stands at the center of this Oscar-laden weepie about macho buddies from a small industrial town.
title: The Deer Hunter

quote: This is probably one of the few great films of the Seventies.
title: The Deer Hunter

quote: It is a heartbreakingly effective fictional machine that evokes the agony of the Vietnam time.
title: The Deer Hunter

quote: Draggy and devastating by turns
title: The Deer Hunter

quote: Its feelings for time, place and blue-collar people are genuine, and its vision is that of an original, major new film maker.
title: The Deer Hunter

quote: Diva is a cinematic textbook on style. It comments on so many facets of the daily contemporary culture -- and of film -- that it seems to be an inspired shorthand.
title: Diva

quote: The movie's a maelstrom of possibilities touching ethnic relations, high art, fashion and modern morality, not to mention cinema.
title: Diva

quote: As with so many pop moments a quarter-century on, what once looked sexy now smells a little sexist.
title: Diva

quote: Diva, as a lifestyle, a fantasy, a model for alienation and solipsism and eccentricity, has gone deep into all of us.
title: Diva

quote: A light-headed, fleet-footed French caper, Jean-Jacques Beineix's ultra-stylish Diva stormed the art houses when it was released in 1982, and it's still a lot of fun now -- though its hip patina feels more quaint these days than cool.
title: Diva

quote: I still loved every minute of it.
title: Diva

quote: Made with wit and humor, this French stunner abounds in the go-for-broke spirit of a first film made by a talented, nervy director.
title: Diva

quote: This is style as a force of nature.
title: Diva

quote: It's a supremely gorgeous and supremely shallow motion picture, but it believes in art with a capital A. And practically nobody does anymore.
title: Diva

quote: Any film with this much stylistic assurance is impossible to fully resist.
title: Diva

quote: The novel touches, bizarre chases and plot twists, breathtaking camerawork by Philippe Rousselot and tension-filled editing, make Diva a superior piece of entertainment.
title: Diva

quote: Half a century later, a glut of über-groovy meta-thrillers has blunted the novelty of Diva, but its gamboling flair is still a kick.
title: Diva

quote: The most exciting debut in years, it is unified by the extraordinary decor - colour supplement chic meets pop art surrealism - which creates a world of totally fantastic reality situated four-square in contemporary Paris.
title: Diva

quote: Here is a director taking audacious chances, doing wild and unpredictable things with his camera and actors, just to celebrate moviemaking.
title: Diva

quote: ...frightfully chic-looking...
title: Diva

quote: A witty, playful intelligent film as enjoyable as it is influential.
title: Diva

quote: Murray, more often than not, is pretty unbearable; but here, playing a man who is unbearable, Murray begins convincingly, amusingly, and gets even more amusing as he metamorphoses.
title: Groundhog Day

quote: Harold Ramis's direction is nothing special, yet there is a beautiful, lip-smacking efficiency in the way that a great idea is touched off and followed to its conclusion.
title: Groundhog Day

quote: While Murray's deadpan putdowns and dry dismissals of provincial peccadilloes are the comic highlights, Groundhog Day is no supercilious rip of small-town U.S.A.
title: Groundhog Day

quote: Groundhog Day may not be the funniest collaboration between Bill Murray and director Harold Ramis... Yet this gentle, small-scale effort is easily the most endearing film of both men's careers, a sweet and amusing surprise package.
title: Groundhog Day

quote: Murray hasn't made a comedy this winningly dumb and smart and -- yes -- sweet in a long time. If, indeed, he ever has.
title: Groundhog Day

quote: A movie that continually replays a single day could quickly become tedious but, strangely enough, Groundhog Day never does.
title: Groundhog Day

quote: Murray's wiseacre persona is perfect for what could be saccharine material in other hands.
title: Groundhog Day

quote: Even if you applaud Bill Murray's evolution from inspired comedian to minimalist seriocomic actor, it's a relief to revisit his most varied and charming role as Phil Connors.
title: Groundhog Day

title: Groundhog Day

quote: Considering that none of the characters is fresh or interesting, it's a commendable achievement that the quality of the storytelling alone keeps the movie watchable and likable.

quote: Ramis' direction is often too cool and restrained. He wisely avoids playing into the tale's underlying sentimentality.
title: Groundhog Day

quote: Since arriving as a mild success in 1993, Groundhog Day has gradually achieved the status of beloved. The American Film Institute rates it No.34 on its list of all-time funniest movies, and it's a story that bears frequent repeat viewings.
title: Groundhog Day

title: Groundhog Day

quote: Mr. Murray is back in top form with a clever, varied role that draws upon the full range of his talents.
title: Groundhog Day

quote: Groundhog will never be designated a national film treasure by the Library of Congress. But, in terms of vehicle selection, this is one of the better ones Murray has hitched himself to.
title: Groundhog Day

quote: ... brilliantly imaginative ...
title: Groundhog Day

quote: The film is lovable and sweet.
title: Groundhog Day

quote: This movie has all the qualities necessary to be a crowd-pleaser: likable characters, charismatic performers, a strong, capably-executed premise, and lots of laughs.
title: Groundhog Day

quote: Clint Eastwood's brilliant and harrowing Unforgiven packs all the punch of a good Western without indulging in the plot cliches and moral certitudes so often inherent in the genre.

quote: Unforgiven is a stark western in slow motion, obsessed with reflection, not action.

quote: A sombre, insightful, genre-reinventing western, directed by a filmmaker acutely aware of the western's history, its limitations and the dubious truths of its legends.

quote: "Unforgiven" is a high-caliber movie, a gripping and haunting work of art that should finally establish Eastwood as one of America's best directors.

quote: It shouldn't be missed by anyone with a taste for Eastwood's typically slanted morality. It's the actor/director's best movie -- and the best Western by anybody -- in over 20 years.

quote: Unforgiven ain't nuthin' new, y'unnerstan', but it's a good, old-fashioned western-type pitcher with plenty o' rootin' tootin' action 'n' big ol' horses 'n' 10-gallon hats 'n' sech.
title: Unforgiven

quote: Eastwood deliberately upends the conventions of the western, subverting his own image in the process.
title: Unforgiven

quote: The Western is back. With a vengeance. Saddle up or get out of the way.

quote: This is the finest set of performances ever to grace a Clint Eastwood movie, and this time Eastwood even does a good job directing Eastwood. Every bullet in this movie matters.

quote: This dark, melancholic film is a reminder-never more necessary than now-of what the American cinema is capable of, in the way of expressing a mature, morally complex and challenging view of the world.

quote: Individual scenes work, but the movie seems overstuffed and halting.
title: Unforgiven

quote: Eastwood's disturbingly human in Unforgiven, a stunning, dark Western that may stand as the actor/director's summation of the form.
title: Unforgiven

quote: Eastwood's meditation on age, repute, courage, heroism -- on all those burdens he has been carrying with such good grace for decades.
title: Unforgiven

quote: One of Unforgiven's assets is the way it overturns conventions, taking the man who is typically the hero and making him the villain, while transforming the traditional bad guy into a sympathetic protagonist.

quote: A classic Western for the ages.
title: Unforgiven

quote: There's not much dramatic urgency apart from the revisionist context.

quote: Good macabre fun.

quote: Dusty but gentle entertainment.
title: Arsenic and Old Lace

quote: Zemeckis and Gale have cannily chosen the time periods, which are funny as much for their similarities (political and materalistic) as their contrasts (music, fashions, language).

quote: Though it is hardly one of the greater flights of cinematic imagination to be seen since science fantasy reared its head as mass appeal material again, it would be virtually impossible not to enjoy it in some way or another.

quote: Kids and parents alike are gonna dig this wonderful fantasy.
title: Back to the Future

quote: This fusion of sci-fi, action, romance and comedy could have been a dreadful mess, were it not for writer-director Robert Zemeckis and co-writer Bob Gale's refusal to let a loose line or idea escape their pens.

quote: It isn't often that extremely clever moviemakers use their brains in the service of pure fun. But that's just what the people who made Back to the Future have done. This brilliant contraption of a film could become the hit of the summer.

quote: It's big, cartoonish and empty, with an interesting premise that is underdeveloped and overproduced.
title: Back to the Future

quote: Zemeckis and Gale... give us two priceless scenes in which the young time-traveler simply regards his parents-to-be with wonderment, delight and empathy. And we cannot help but share that emotion and relate it to our own lives.

quote: The picture packs a wonderful wallop.

quote: "Future" fandom resonates in the public imagination because it marries innocence with high-concept fun.

quote: A little more sophistication would have been no bad thing -- but a good script keeps it zipping along.

quote: Delightful and sophisticated to a degree beyond the dreams of today's movies in similar vein.

quote: Shows not only a fine comic touch but also some of the lighthearted humanism of a Frank Capra.

quote: So busy being clever that it trips over its own ingenuity.

quote: [A] clunky, fraudulent, yet apparently crowd-pleasing laugh-and-tear-jerker.

quote: I'd like to pin four stars on each shoulder of George C. Scott for his perspective characterization of the military genius, the controversial man.

quote: The movie's vision blurs the man and, incidentally, the just war around him.

quote: The film lays bare the roots of Patton's lust for power in his willingess to sacrifice everything to his vaunting ego, a trait which is mirrored in George C Scott's superb performance.

quote: Scott strikes an unforgettable figure.

quote: Scott's theatricality is electrifying.

quote: Remains to this day one of Hollywood's most compelling biographical war pictures.

quote: Down By Law is oddly heart-warming, magnifying moments of unexpected camaraderie between kindred spirits who don't immediately ID each other as such.

quote: A dark, dank and derivative horror ride only an Orkin man could truly love.

quote: ...it flies on and on until its power to hold us simply peters out.
title: Air Force One

quote: It's a great ride.
title: Air Force One

quote: Moments of silliness are more than balanced by Petersen's extraordinary ability to keep this movie flight-worthy, Ford's almost-executive presence and an outstanding performance from Oldman.

quote: Air Force One doesn't insult the audience. It is crafted by a film-maker who takes pride in the thrills and sly fun he packs into every frame.

quote: A piece of expertly crafted entertainment that gets the job done with skill and panache
title: Air Force One

quote: Seeing the president of the United States as a kick-butt action hero pretty much sums up the appeal of Air Force One
title: Air Force One

quote: Preposterous but viscerally juicy

quote: As it is, the movie is a roller coaster ride for those who prefer not to think once the theater lights have dimmed.

quote: It's a gamble. Air Force One goes against the current grain of presenting presidents in movies as evil or idiotic, or mock heroic, as in last year's 'Independence Day.'
title: Air Force One

quote: The stalking struggle between reason and unreason that precedes it is much more gripping--and fun.

quote: Up to this moment, every detail ... has been exact ... But, because of that initial realism, audiences accept the fakery of what follows ... a president who, in physical prowess and stamina, makes Arnold Schwarzenegger look limp.

quote: The two hours of this movie felt like such an eternity that I was certain my clothes were going to be out of style by the time it was over.

quote: You may not be limp from accumulated tension when this hunt is over, but its cautiously upbeat global message leaves a satisfying glow and it operates with a crackerjack premise.

quote: The film mechanically uses the crosscutting technique made famous by Kubrick's Dr. Strangelove without any of its wit or focused energy.
title: The Hunt for Red October

quote: The film is a piece of heightened prosaic suspense; it comes at you in big, chewy gobs of exposition and dialogue.

quote: The Hunt for Red October is a terrific adventure yarn.
title: The Hunt for Red October

quote: At its best, with Soviets, Americans and Raimus all at cross-purposes, the movie is an engrossing and exciting battle of wits.

quote: The movie finally is never very convincing. Even the special effects aren't great.

quote: A leviathan bore, big, clunky and ponderously overplotted.

quote: A Reagan youth's wet dream of underwater ballistics and East-West conflict.

quote: A skillful, efficient film.

quote: A simultaneously heartbreaking and exhilarating road movie.

quote: This is a very rich, very sympathetic piece of work.
title: My Own Private Idaho

quote: [Van Sant] disdain[s] narrative. He got away with Drugstore Cowboy because its band of drugged-out dodoes were engaged in a petty crime spree that almost passed for a plot. But My Own Private Idaho is a different story. Or rather nonstory.

quote: One of the most original cinematic talents at work in this country, Van Sant has a knack for pulling disparate elements together and twisting them into wildly funny lyrical odysseys of the mind and heart.

title: My Own Private Idaho

quote: Van Sant takes a lot of chances, and, visually, the movie is so imaginative, so fiercely alive, that it carries us along. But when the over-all design of the picture becomes clear, we feel cheated rather than enlightened.
title: My Own Private Idaho

quote: My Own Private Idaho lacks the dramatic punchiness of Drugstore Cowboy, yet it's a rich, audacious experience.
title: My Own Private Idaho

quote: My Own Private Idaho is a far cry from seamless, but I would gladly trade a dozen well-made studio movies for one of its vital parts.
title: My Own Private Idaho

quote: One of those ambitious, over-reaching disappointments that is more interesting than some more conservative successes.
title: My Own Private Idaho

quote: The film's uniqueness lies in its remarkable emotional open-heartedness.
title: My Own Private Idaho

quote: The performances, especially by the two young stars, are as surprising as they are sure.
title: My Own Private Idaho

quote: An essential testament to the beauty and chops of the late River Phoenix...
title: My Own Private Idaho

quote: The achievement of this film is that is wants to evoke that state of drifting need, and it does.
title: My Own Private Idaho

quote: Van Sant's sensibility is wholly original, wholly fresh. My Own Private Idaho adds a new ingredient: a kind of boho sweetness. I loved it.

quote: Even though it falters toward the end, it soars above the fray.
title: My Own Private Idaho

quote: Star Maps reads like a collision involving three or four scripts in different stages of development.

quote: It's subtly funny in the way it toys with the cliches of the genre.
title: The Edge

quote: I laughed frequently, but the problem is that I'm not sure the director intended there to be as much humor in his film as I uncovered.

quote: ...a solid man-against-nature tale...

title: The Edge

quote: But it's too predictable by half, and Mamet's profundities have more volume than mass.

quote: Hops the globe like an old Bob Hope troop show in a futilely frenzied attempt to obscure script weaknesses.

quote: L.A. Confidential is a movie bull's-eye: noir with an attitude, a thriller packing punches. It gives up its evil secrets with a smile.

title: L.A. Confidential

quote: Hanson has made the film noir setting virtually another starring character.
title: L.A. Confidential

quote: Spicy and boiling-hot, this sensational early-'50s crime drama is a morality play disguised as pulp fiction -- a sprawling saga of corruption and redemption set against a flashy West Coast backdrop.
title: L.A. Confidential

quote: Hanson delivers something ever rarer in film culture, not a new film noir but an old-fashioned total movie, somehow of a single piece.

quote: This may be the best movie of the year; it's definitely one of the greatest crime films of all time.

title: L.A. Confidential

quote: The multi-layered plot keeps you riveted for the best possible reason -- you can't start to imagine where the story is leading you, and the fiercely intense payoffs are repeatedly worth the extra concentration.

quote: This 1950s-era crime drama has it all, and does it all with a casual mastery that Hollywood once owned but had seemingly misplaced or lost.
title: L.A. Confidential

quote: With its plot that zigs and zags like knife slashes, its cynicism stoked to the melting point, the movie brings the thrill of corruption crackingly to life.
title: L.A. Confidential

quote: You have to pay close attention to follow the double-crossing intricacies of the plot, but the reward for your work is dark and dirty fun.
title: L.A. Confidential

quote: Stop reading. Put this review on hold until after you've seen L.A. Confidential.
title: L.A. Confidential

quote: An irresistible treat with enough narrative twists and memorable characters for a half-dozen films.
title: L.A. Confidential

quote: This movie restores genre elements to a level of potency that's disturbing, satisfying, and rare as hell.
title: L.A. Confidential

quote: A parlor game has already begun as to whether the supreme acting revelation in L.A. Confidential is provided by Mr. Crowe, Mr. Spacey or Mr. Pearce.
title: L.A. Confidential

title: L.A. Confidential

quote: A rattling good police story and a dark, laughing tone poem to the never-innocent city of illusions.
title: L.A. Confidential

quote: Against all odds, L.A. Confidential succeeds brilliantly, right down to Jerry Goldsmith's score, which evokes his haunting theme from Chinatown without being haunted by it.
title: L.A. Confidential

quote: The movie is about two characters and is told from the point of view of the wrong one.

title: Soul Food

quote: Tillman is tremendously skilled at bridging the vast shifts in tone.
title: Soul Food

quote: A hearty, old fashioned meal of a film.
title: Soul Food

quote: A warm, funny, touching African American family drama, the kind of bittersweet melodrama that critics tend to relegate as crowd-pleasing corn. We could use more when it's this well done.
title: Soul Food

title: Soul Food

title: Wishmaster

quote: Despite the golden promise of the cornfields, its crops are barren.

quote: Think obsessive-compulsive Lady Macbeth or Ophelia with an eating disorder, and you have an idea of just how simplistic that seems.

quote: The best art of any age typically comes from the dysfunctional artist, and U-Turn is just that -- Stone's oddball glimpse into a shadow America that no one wants to believe exists but that undoubtedly does.

title: U Turn

title: U Turn

quote: The film takes so many detours that at least one or two of them are bound to surprise even the most jaded movie-goer.

quote: It demonstrates a filmmaker in complete command of his craft and with little control over his impulses.

quote: Schlesinger has conceived his film as an epic, which was a daring thing to do with such slender material.

quote: It simply isn't all that funny.

quote: You feel embarrassed for the actors and the crew that had to film them.

quote: Nunez's use of melodrama is as refreshingly anti-Hollywood as ever: the action is entirely in the service of character. What's startling about this quiet, un-hyped-up film is how moving it is.

quote: It would be accurate but barely adequate to call this the finest work of Mr. Fonda's career.

quote: Nothing less than one of the year's best pictures, a portrait of wealthy Connecticut suburbanites in the 1970s whose lives have no emotional or spiritual rudder.

quote: A thoroughly enjoyable blend of comedy and melodrama...

quote: Leonard Bernstein's rich, eloquent and demanding score is still a powerful experience.

quote: It has sex, Eastmancolor, some prime performers and plenty of action.

quote: Despite the fitful energy and the beauty of the settings, the ugliness of the mise en scene and the crudity of the editing tend to triumph.

quote: The acting, showy and instinctual, is most of the movie; the visual style is too forced and chicly distended to let the drama acquire much natural life of its own.

quote: Its trigger-fast, explosive scenes and high-tension chase sequences (the one in "Bullitt" pales by comparison) will have you literally gasping for breath.

title: Terms of Endearment

quote: This is a chamber movie with the courage to stay small and resonant.

quote: Freeman is note-perfect with Hoke's dignified warmth, and Tandy, whose every moment on screen is an acting lesson, turns in what by far is the most hauntingly elegant performance of the year.
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: Every one of these dramatic maelstroms manages to appear fresh because Freeman and Tandy somehow manage to come up with new approaches, meting out complementary aspects of their characters.
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: The movie never resorts to sentimentality. It has a dry wit as well as genuine warmth. Best of all it is the perfect showcase for two deserving actors -- Jessica Tandy and Morgan Freeman.
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: One of the year's best films, a rarity in that a play has been successfully transferred to film without having the dialogue seem "written."
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: Driving Miss Daisy spans a quarter-century in the intricate relationship of a Southern dowager and her chauffeur, and it is a movie that invites you to appreciate the passage of time in more than one way.
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: Jessica Tandy and Morgan Freeman give exceptional performances
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: Freeman and Tandy have their own performer's pride, and that transfers to their characters. Tandy, in particular, is almost astringent in her denial of easy emotion.
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: This is a story about people, not politics. And perhaps because we can see the actors in closeup on the screen, that is even truer of the movie than the play.
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: For Tandy, it's her most substantial film role since her sublime work in Alfred Hitchcock`s 1963 The Birds, and she takes full advantage of it; never playing for sympathy, she earns it completely.
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: Alfred Uhry's adaptation of his Pulitzer-prizewinning play aspires more to complex observation of human behavior than to simple moralism about it. Precisely because it has its priorities straight, it succeeds superbly on both levels.
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: Bruce Beresford's sensitive direction complements Alfred Uhry's skillful adapation of his Pulitzer Prize-winning play.
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: The movie also has something legitimate and instructive to say about the subtlety and intricacy of everyday race relations in the south during the period covered (roughly 1948 to '73).
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: Far too cosy to serve as an effective social or political metaphor; better to regard it as a solid ensemble piece.
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: There is an exhilarating, singularly theatrical lightness of touch that is often lost when these settings are made manifest in a movie.
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: This is Tandy's finest two hours onscreen in a film career that goes back to 1932.
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: The movie gets you mainly because Morgan Freeman, who played chauffeur Hoke Colburn in the original stage production (and won his third Obie for it), takes the wheel and drives Daisy all the way home.
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: The story holds a potential for sap that is mostly unfulfilled thanks to Beresford's stately approach, the stars' better judgment and the protagonists' sharp wits.
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: Driving Miss Daisy is a film of great love and patience, telling a story that takes 25 years to unfold, exploring its characters as few films take the time to do.
title: Driving Miss Daisy

quote: Whatever its genesis, Allen's scraggly rhetoric evolved into the dominant comic style of the 70s.

quote: A few good laughs in an 85-minute film do not a comedy make.

quote: It has plenty of hilarious jokes and concepts, like the ventriloquists' dummies at prison visiting time, and the return home from a chaingang break with five shackled cons in tow.
title: Take the Money and Run

quote: Allen has made a movie that is, in effect, a feature-length, two-reel comedy -- something very special and eccentric and funny.
title: Take the Money and Run

quote: Woody Allen's Take the Money and Run has some very funny moments, and you'll laugh a lot, but in the last analysis it isn't a very funny movie.
title: Take the Money and Run

quote: As close to a classic as anything New Hollywood produced.
title: Klute

quote: What lifts it above its B-picture origins (and the pastiche is certainly conscious) is the style -- crisp, elliptical, only moderately arty -- of Alan J. Pakula's direction.

quote: This is done with remarkably little dialogue but with a tremendous sense of tension and atmosphere.
title: Klute

quote: A movie resolutely of its moment that still surges with third-rail electricity ...
title: Klute

quote: Produced handsomely in New York, but directed tediously by Alan J. Pakula, the film is a suspenser without much suspense.
title: Klute

quote: [Fonda] makes all the right choices, from the mechanics of her walk and her voice inflection to the penetration of the girl's raging psyche. It is a rare performance.
title: Klute

quote: For once, a genuinely psychological thriller.
title: Klute

quote: With Fonda and Sutherland, you have actors who understand and sympathize with their characters, and you have a vehicle worthy of that sort of intelligence. So the fact that the thriller stuff doesn't always work isn't so important.
title: Klute

quote: Pakula, when he is not indulging in subjective camera, strives to give his film the look of structural geometry, but despite the sharp edges and dramatic spaces and cinema presence out of Citizen Kane, it all suggests a tepid, rather tasteless mush.

quote: Informed in part by the conventions of film noir...Klute manages to distil them all into something highly original and distinctly unsettling.
title: Klute

quote: Repo Man has the type of unerring energy that leaves audiences breathless and entertained.

quote: There are endless things to enjoy, from Robby Mller's crisp camerawork to a superb set of performances, from witty movie parodies to a tremendous punk soundtrack.

quote: Repo Man comes out of left field, has no big stars, didn't cost much, takes chances, dares to be unconventional, is funny, and works. There is a lesson here.

quote: It's very entertaining, and though it's rude in an R-rated way, it has the good taste never to promise more than it can deliver.

quote: Stillman hasn't made as hermetically appealing a movie since, but for those lamenting the absence of the written word in modern comedy - rather than the improvisationally blurted-out kind - "Metropolitan" makes for delightful memory-lane viewing.

title: Metropolitan

quote: It might make you long for a return to movies in which teens have a greater vocabulary than their parents.
title: Metropolitan

quote: Stillman films these rounds of romance and jealousy, old mind-sets and new friendships, as scintillating dialectical jousts in which verbal blows take the place of action and leave lasting emotional wounds.
title: Metropolitan

quote: Whit Stillman's crafty independent feature about wealthy Park Avenue teenagers and a middle-class boy who joins their ranks over one Christmas vacation is certainly well imagined, and impressively acted by a cast of newcomers.
title: Metropolitan

quote: A witty, urbane portrait of Manhattan's debutante scene.
title: Metropolitan

quote: It's the beautifully chiselled dialogue -- counterpointed by near-static camerawork and a nicely mannered acting style -- that remains the chief attraction.
title: Metropolitan

quote: Filmmaker Whit Stillman makes a strikingly original debut with Metropolitan, a glib, ironic portrait of the vulnerable young heirs to Manhattan's disappearing debutante scene.
title: Metropolitan

quote: None of Stillman's endearing characters quite fits their prescribed social context, and in its exhilarated final movement, Metropolitan finds an exit out of the stifling UHB salon.
title: Metropolitan

quote: Not very much happens in Metropolitan, and yet everything that happens is felt deeply, because the characters in this movie are still too young to have perfected their defenses against life.
title: Metropolitan

quote: True appreciation for this movie may be restricted to those with firsthand experience in this kind of world, or a certain upper-haute stamina.
title: Metropolitan

quote: Like chamber music, Metropolitan is sprightly, intimate and all too self-aware.
title: Metropolitan

quote: While the off-kilter rock songs Bowie wrote and performed for the film are far from his best work, his character performance is gloriously iconic, a perfect blend of predatory, leering rock star and hurt, rejected emo lover.

quote: Henson's imagination is boundless. But his movie has no pep. It's a dream in neutral.

quote: A real masterpiece of puppetry and special effects, an absolutely gorgeous children's fantasy movie.
title: Labyrinth

quote: A remarkable achievement.
title: Labyrinth

quote: Great energy and creativity went into the construction, production and direction of this movie, but it doesn't have a story that does justice to the production.
title: Labyrinth

quote: [Hughes] understands adolescents as well as anyone who has ever made movies about them, and he has a fluent way with young actors. In this picture, his dramatic ideas may be cheesy, but Hughes still manages to create some excitement and laughs.
